summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing draft responses to defense counsel's discovery and preservation requests in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It includes attachments of three defense letters and coordination on the prosecution's reply.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the case; defense counsel is making discovery and preservation requests on his behalf.

events.title: Defense letter requesting preservation and production
events.description: Epstein's defense counsel sends a letter requesting preservation and production of materials.

events.title: Defense supplemental letter and broad discovery request
events.description: Epstein's defense counsel sends a supplemental preservation request and a separate, broad discovery request letter.

events.title: Prosecution coordination on response
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discuss and coordinate their draft response to the defense's discovery requests.

keyFacts: The defense made three discovery/preservation requests: one on July 26, 2019, and two supplemental/broad ones on August 1, 2019.
The prosecution was preparing a response to the defense requests, specifically addressing the two related to the NPA (Non-Prosecution Agreement).
The email chain shows internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on the Epstein case in August 2019.
The correspondence indicates an active discovery phase in the legal proceedings against Jeffrey Epstein at that time.
The identities of the specific prosecutors/attorneys involved are redacted in the document.
